You have to prepare at least $n$ potions. There are two types of spells that can help you:

* **Type 1:**  Each spell costs $b_i$ mana points and reduces the time to prepare one potion from $x$ seconds to $a_i$ seconds. You can use at most one spell of this type.
* **Type 2:** Each spell costs $d_i$ mana points and instantly creates $c_i$ potions. You can use at most one spell of this type.

You have a total of $s$ mana points. Find the minimum time required to prepare at least $n$ potions, considering you can use spells instantly before starting to prepare potions. 

**Input:**

* $n$: The number of potions to prepare.
* $m$: The number of Type 1 spells.
* $k$: The number of Type 2 spells.
* $x$: The initial time to prepare one potion.
* $s$: The total mana points available.
* $a_i$: The time to prepare one potion after using the $i$-th Type 1 spell.
* $b_i$: The mana cost of the $i$-th Type 1 spell.
* $c_i$: The number of potions created instantly by the $i$-th Type 2 spell.
* $d_i$: The mana cost of the $i$-th Type 2 spell.

**Output:**

* The minimum time required to prepare at least $n$ potions.

You have a task to make a certain number of items. There are two types of special actions you can take to speed up the process:

1. Use a special action that reduces the time to make one item. You can only use this action once.
2. Use a special action that instantly creates a number of items. You can only use this action once.

You have a limited amount of resources to spend on these actions. Find the minimum time it takes to make all the required items, considering the cost and effects of each action.
